alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 5:53AM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar affecting Carbon County. .The river will continue to fall today, falling below flood stage this afternoon. For the Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone...including Edgar...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is occurring and the river is forecast to fall below flood stage later today. * WHERE...Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar. * WHEN...Until this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM MDT Wednesday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 9.5 feet this morning. It will fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone Edgar 9.0 9.6 Wed 5 am 7.4 7.1 7.6 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued bythis evening at 600 PM MDT.
